New Records: Dawid Malan became the oldest Englishman to score a World Cup hundred.
Joe Root surpassed Graham Gooch as England's leading run-scorer in World Cups.
Key Match Events: Reece Topley took 4 wickets for 43 runs.
Reece Topley struck with his fourth, fifth, and 16th balls, leaving Bangladesh at 26 for 3.
Chris Woakes ended Litton Das's hopes of a hundred by dismissing him.
Mushfiqur Rahim was dismissed by Reece Topley.
Post-Match Reflections: England produced an emphatic response to their opening World Cup match defeat.
Shakib Al Hasan accepted the sanction for Bangladesh's over-rate fine.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Bangladesh were fined 5% of their match fee for being one over behind the required over rate.
Bangladesh bowled with only four fielders outside the 30-yard circle to finish England's innings.
